items.sentence: I think I\'ve found a solution to your problem.
I wonder if Tom ever took Mary up on her offer.
I\'m not sure that Tom is ready to do that yet.
I went up to my room and looked out the window.
Lots of things were happening at the same time.
Have you told Tom why you want to study French?
I\'ll give these tickets to whoever wants them.
This floor is so clean you could eat off of it.
I can\'t believe that Tom did all this himself.
Tom apologized for not having told Mary sooner.
Tom asked Mary how she had lost so much weight.
Tom told everyone he wanted to become a barber.
Tom told me he was thinking of going to Boston.
I\'ve been looking forward to meeting you, Tom.
I\'ve been on the road since 2:30 this morning.
Don\'t put your books on the dining room table.
Before I do anything, I\'d like to talk to Tom.
Tom wouldn\'t mind if Mary gained a few pounds.
Tom\'s analysis of the situation seems correct.
Tom said he thought there was no need to hurry.
Tom said he was kidnapped when he was thirteen.
Tom said he was working on something important.
Tom says that he and Mary are moving to Boston.
Tom says that he just wants to make Mary happy.
Tom told Mary that he wasn\'t going to do that.
Tom told Mary that he\'d help her wash her car.
Tom told Mary that he\'d look into the problem.
It took Tom three hours to finish his homework.
I think it would\'ve been difficult to do that.
Tom walked past Mary without even noticing her.
Tom wanted Mary to tell him that she loved him.
I found it difficult to track down information.
Mary told me that she thought Tom was handsome.
Mary wanted Tom to pretend to be her boyfriend.
Mary will be wearing a blue dress to the dance.
Are you really thinking of buying that old car?
I\'ll ask Tom to carry your suitcases upstairs.
I thought if I left Boston, I could forget you.
Tom didn\'t make enough brownies for everybody.
Tom didn\'t say anything about going to Boston.
Tom told me he usually eats breakfast at seven.
Tom told me that Mary was the one who did that.
Mary grabbed her purse and headed for the door.
Mary has known Tom since she was a little girl.
Mary has no idea how much Tom wants to see her.
Mary hopes Tom will sit next to her on the bus.
Tom always sleeps cuddled up to his Teddy Bear.
Tom told Mary that he could meet her on Monday.
We have some things that we need to talk about.
Tom explained to Mary in detail how to do that.
